qas.question: With whom did Dominic travel with to Denmark?
Who requested that Dominic travel to Denmark?
In 1203, what area was a stronghold of the Cathar?
During what time period did the Albigensian Crusade occur?
Why did Dominic travel to Denmark in 1203?

answers.text: to arrange the marriage between the son of King Alfonso VIII of Castile and a niece of King Valdemar II of Denmark

context: In 1203, Dominic joined <a0_0>Prior Diego de Acebo<a0_0/> on an embassy to Denmark for the <a1_0>monarchy of Spain<a1_0/>, <a4_0>to arrange the marriage between the son of King Alfonso VIII of Castile and a niece of King Valdemar II of Denmark<a4_0/>. At that time the <a2_0>south of France<a2_0/> was the stronghold of the Cathar or Albigensian heresy, named after the Duke of Albi, a Cathar sympathiser and opponent to the subsequent Albigensian Crusade (<a3_0>1209–1229<a3_0/>). Dominic was fired by a reforming zeal after they encountered Albigensian Christians at Toulouse.
